main event: On the night of 9 June 1953, an unidentified object was observed in the sky near Pyongyang, North Korea, by military personnel
interesting points: The object was first sighted at an altitude of approximately 40,000 feet and appeared to be spherical in shape
Witnesses described the color of the object as luminous or phosphorescent and estimated its size to be approximately 7,000 yards in diameter
The observations of the object were made for a period of approximately 45 minutes
Official comments stated that any conclusions regarding the identity of the object would be purely speculative
Although a program was instituted to investigate these sightings, no further investigation was made
